<!-- need to add: Chancellors statements from before Nov 19, Nov 19 statements, specific calls for resignation, petition refs-->
Much of the the response has focused on calls for a new Chancellor to replace the current Chancellor Linda P.B. Katehi. Two members of the faculty have publicly called for a new chancellor, and signatures are being gathered on petitions for a new chancellor.
Much of the the response has focused on calls for a new Chancellor to replace the current Chancellor Linda P.B. Katehi. Two members of the faculty have publicly called for a new chancellor, and signatures are being gathered on petitions for a new chancellor.
  +   +
On November 19, the board of UC Davis Faculty issued a statement calling for both the immediate resignation of the Chancellor and for an end to police removal of non-violent protestors from the campus:
  +
{{quote|Given the recent use of excessive force by police against âoccupyâ protestors at UC Berkeley and elsewhere, the Chancellor must have anticipated that, by authorizing police action, she was effectively authorizing their use of excessive force against peaceful UCD student protestors. The Chancellorâs role is to enable open and free inquiry, not to suppress it.<br/><br/>We also call for a policy that will end the practice of forcibly removing non-violent student, faculty, staff, and community protestors by police on the UC Davis campus. The University of California should be taking a leadership role in encouraging the exercise of free speech, not in suppressing it.<ref>[[http://ucdfa.org/2011/11/19/dfa-board-calls-for-katehis-resignation/ DFA Board Calls for Katehiâs Resignation]</ref>}}
On November 19, Katehi called for creation of a task force to review the incident and report their findings and recommendations within 90 days.<ref> {{cite news |newspaper= [[Los Angeles Times]] |title=UC Davis chief launches probe into pepper-spraying of Occupy protesters |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-occupy-uc-davis-20111120,0,2407596.story |first1=Paul |last1= Pringle | first2=Sam
